pr_title: Hive: Add missing transitive dependency when reading parquet files

timeline.message:
Hive: Add missing transitive dependency when reading parquet files

When reading Hive tables that are stored as parquet files, and the
tables have timestamp types (INT96 primitive type), then PXF is unable
to read the table because PXF is missing a transitive dependency
(org.jodd:jodd-core). This commit adds the missing transitive
dependency, and adds tests to make sure this issue is not encountered in
the future.

timeline.bodyText: Don't you need ORDER BY to guarantee order of records ?
timeline.author: denalex
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,3 @@
+-- @description query01 for PXF Hive parquet timestamp
+
+SELECT * FROM pxf_hive_parquet_timestamp;

replies.bodyText: I would also feel better if there was an ORDER BY.
replies.author: oliverralbertini

replies.bodyText:
A single file is created because a single insert statement is performed. But I will add the order by clause for peace of mind
https://github.com/greenplum-db/pxf/pull/332/files#diff-8d1b90518e58a14500ec6a5046cce97dR355
replies.author: frankgh
